Articles.Content: Hey KSP forums, my name is Lexi and I've been playing KSP since December 2012. How big of a ship would I need to send my Kerbals to Duna, and how do you keep one perpetual save interesting?

Hi LexiSilva, welcome to the community

You don't need a big craft to get to Duna and back, as you can see with the craft here

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/33324-Kerbolar-Demo-Parts-Extravaganza!?p=442362&viewfull=1#post442362

Welcome to the forums! I hope Sal managed to answer your question. When I first when to Duna at the dawn of .18, my first landing on another planet, I essentially packed a bunch (8) nuclear engines in an asparagus staging system behind the tiny unmanned lander. Once you get a general idea of dV changes you can pretty much eyeball it. Don't bother with calculations if you don't have the exact formulas: I once made a probe for laythe with 8k m/s dV in orbit. I actually ran all the numbers with pen and paper and thought I just had ~2k m/s. If you have any questions, feel free to PM me!
